thread.title: Platte Valley volleyball team tops University with defensive performance
thread.title_full: Platte Valley volleyball team tops University with defensive performance

author: Nicole Durham
title: Platte Valley volleyball team tops University with defensive performance
text: Staff reports Volleyball Kersey— With senior libero Jazmin Barrera leading the way, Platte Valley used a lights-out defensive performance to power past Class 3A Patriot League foe University, 25-20, 25-15, 25-14, on Monday. Barrera had a match-high 26 digs to go with an ace and three assists. “Jazmin Barrera had a really, really good night for us,” Broncos coach Jared Rudiger said. “Jazmin played very good, disciplined defense.” Rudiger’s squad gave up just one ace. Platte Valley improved to 9-3 in league, 14-4 overall, evening the season series against the Bulldogs. University fell to 8-2, 10-2. Bulldogs coach Lindsey Brown said her team lacked energy in front of a packed house, as the Broncos hosted their annual Cancer Awareness Match. “We came in a little flat,” Brown said. “We just made a lot of unforced errors.” Platte Valley made sophomore Bo Miller its honorary team captain. Miller is battling Leukemia after being diagnosed this past summer. UHS 20 15 14 PVHS 25 25 25 UHS — Kills: Aracely Hernandez 6, McKayla Bauer 4, Katie Potter 3, Kiahlei Yaste 3; Assists: Bauer 9, Abby Schaefer 6; Aces: Lindsey Halverson; Blocks: Bauer 5, Stephania Pumphrey 2, Potter 2; Digs: Halverson 24, Schaefer 15, Hernandez 13. PVHS — Kills: Maggie Smith 14, Adrianna Rios 9, Kylie Sharp 6, Annika Zenk 6; Assists: Maddie Uyemura 26, Jazmin Barrera 3; Aces: McKenzie Johnson 2, Uyemura 2, Michaela Hill, Barrera; Blocks: Zenk 4, Smith 3, Taylor Arb, Jacey Reinert, Sharp; Digs: Barrera 26, Rios 17, Smith 15.
